page.title: 04DARTMOUTH FERRIES (1)
page.content: There are{three}ferries that run between Dartmouth and Kingswear. They replace the{"Mew",}a large coal_fired vessel (later converted to oil) which used to carry both cars and passengers between the pontoons. There is evidence that there has been a crossing point here since{1365. { The Higher Car Ferry}(built 1960) is propelled by two large paddle wheels and guided along two steel cables. It can carry up to 18 cars, or 4 coaches, and runs every 15 minutes. {The Lower Car Ferry}is pulled by one of three diesel tugs: Hauley 2 (made at Percy Mitchels Yard, Mevagissy) Hauleys 4 and 5 (made at Philips of Dartmouth). Each ferry can carry up to 8 cars every 20 minutes. Two ferries are used during the summer months. (continued next page)
